interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Don't Go Near The Water (Remastered)
Review Date: 2011/12/16
Store: Charles Walters  (Director),     Glenn Ford  (Actor),     Gia Scala  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
Product Description: ["They also serve who only sit and type! Hollywood brought audiences to atten-hut! in the 1950s and '60s with a string of military comedies like Mr. Roberts, Operation Petticoat, Ensign Pulver, No Time for Sergeants and this splash into the typing pool of dry-land sailors -- a Navy publicity team in the World War II Pacific. Glenn Ford, who appeared in a fistful of the era's service comedies, stars as a lieutenant with a knack for PR activities like placating big shots, calming romantic waters, deflating puffed-up journalists and puffing a profane-mouthed gob into the public's idea of the perfect enlisted man. Also in the large, shipshape cast: Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn and Mickey Shaughnessy."]
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Contributor': 'Glenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ TamblynGlenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ Tamblyn   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Charles Walters', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2011', 'Actors': 'Glenn Ford, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn', 'Studio': 'MGM', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This has always been one of my favorite movies. I was so happy to see it finally release on DVD.  However, Warner Brothers could have done a much better job on the DVD.  It is shown in a 2.35:1 widescreen format.  I believe that Amazon said 1.78:1, which is incorrect.  The case says remastered, but I found the quality of the picture way below what it should be.  The picture is grainy and the sound is only so-so.  For the price, I was expecting better.  There are NO SUBTITLES.  You would think if it was "remastered" they could at least add that feature.  Having said all this, the movie is still a hoot.  Glad to add it to my dvd collection.  They just don't make them this entertaining anymore.
Review Title: WB could have done better!
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Don't Go Near The Water (Remastered)
Charles Walters  (Director),     Glenn Ford  (Actor),     Gia Scala  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
["They also serve who only sit and type! Hollywood brought audiences to atten-hut! in the 1950s and '60s with a string of military comedies like Mr. Roberts, Operation Petticoat, Ensign Pulver, No Time for Sergeants and this splash into the typing pool of dry-land sailors -- a Navy publicity team in the World War II Pacific. Glenn Ford, who appeared in a fistful of the era's service comedies, stars as a lieutenant with a knack for PR activities like placating big shots, calming romantic waters, deflating puffed-up journalists and puffing a profane-mouthed gob into the public's idea of the perfect enlisted man. Also in the large, shipshape cast: Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn and Mickey Shaughnessy."]
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Contributor': 'Glenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ TamblynGlenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ Tamblyn   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Charles Walters', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2011', 'Actors': 'Glenn Ford, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn', 'Studio': 'MGM', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
This has always been one of my favorite movies. I was so happy to see it finally release on DVD.  However, Warner Brothers could have done a much better job on the DVD.  It is shown in a 2.35:1 widescreen format.  I believe that Amazon said 1.78:1, which is incorrect.  The case says remastered, but I found the quality of the picture way below what it should be.  The picture is grainy and the sound is only so-so.  For the price, I was expecting better.  There are NO SUBTITLES.  You would think if it was "remastered" they could at least add that feature.  Having said all this, the movie is still a hoot.  Glad to add it to my dvd collection.  They just don't make them this entertaining anymore.
WB could have done better!
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest:** Classic Comedy Films
- **Content Preference:** Strong affinity for military-themed comedies from the 1950s and 1960s, indicating a nostalgic appreciation for this genre.
- **Format:** Prefers DVDs, particularly remastered versions, demonstrating a value for quality in presentation.
- **Quality Expectations:** High expectations for remastered content. Disappointment expressed regarding picture and sound quality, suggesting that the user prioritizes technical aspects of media.
- **Purchase Behavior:** Engages with nostalgic classics, showing a pattern of collecting favorite films. Enjoyment of the film is cited despite technical shortcomings, indicating a willingness to overlook flaws in favor of content.
- **Review Tendencies:** Balanced reviews highlighting both positive experiences and constructive criticisms. This user provides detailed feedback, indicating a thoughtful approach to reviewing purchases.
- **Engagement with Content:** Clearly enjoys discussing films, evidenced by detailed reviews and ratings, suggesting an interest in sharing opinions with others.

Overall, the user’s pattern suggests a dedicated movie enthusiast who values both the historical significance and entertainment quality of classic films, but also has a discerning eye for production quality.
